presentation.title: Leveraging the Web Platform for the Web of Things

slide.title: Abstract
slide.p: Web Architecture provides a general-purpose way of establishing an interlinked network of resources, which are interacted with through the exchange of representations of their state. We argue that the Web of Things fits well into this general framework, and thus should be built firmly on the foundation provided by Web Architecture. We also argue that in order to allow an evolutionary path towards a Web of Things, it is important to take small and incremental steps towards the final goal, instead of trying to establish a grand Web of Things Architecture in one monolithic step. One interesting first step could be to focus on Activity Streams as one way how streams of resource updates can be represented in a uniform, extensible, and machine-readable way.
